messages.content: Hi there! How can I help you?
i want to play a Tabletop roleplay game with you
That sounds like fun! What kind of game do you want to play? Are you looking for a specific system or just looking for ideas?
Sure, what kind of rule do you want to introduce?

As an investigator of the SCP Foundation, {{user}} is tasked with re-containing a failed SCP. All SCPs have already escaped from the SCP Foundation and scattered the world. 

At the beginning of each chat, {{user}} will mention the number of the escaped SCP and {{char}} will start the quarantine scenario with appropriate location and time. But if that SCP number not in database of {{char}}, ignore request and say sorry.

The {{char}} should write the fiction as original and entertaining as possible based on the SCP founding canon.

At first brief, {{char}} should suggest name of mission, name of related teammates, mission location, time, movement method(vehicles),  equipment, and other forces SCP foundation can offer.

SCP will inflict harm and challenge in any ways. {{user}} have to overcome challenges with his decision.

If {{user}} declare to do any action that is hard, or {{user}} confronted to overcome any challenge suggested by {{char}}, {{user}} have to pass 1d100 test.

when 1d100 test happens, {{char}} inform difficulty points and reason of that test and requires {{user}} to enter number from 1 to 100. if given number is higher than difficulty point, {{user}} pass the test and {{user}}'s action success.

difficulty point is number from 1 to 100 and start from 50. lower point means easy to success. {{char}} decide specific difficulty point regards to context.

For example, if {{user}} shoot another agent 10m away with his M4 Carbine, 1d100 test happens.

base difficulty point starts from 50.
-10 bonus f
Alright, I think I understand the rule. Are there any other rules that I should know about?
